Warm-up: Q1

What is the output of this program?

int main() {
    int sum = 0;
    int nums[] = { 1, 3, 5, 7 };
    for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
        nums[i+1] -= 1;
        sum += nums[i];
    }
    printf("%d\n", sum);
}

Warm-up: Q2

What is the output of this program?

int main() {
    int sum = 0;
    int zeros[10];
    for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
        sum += zeros[i];
    }
    printf("%d\n", sum);
}

Warm-up: Q3

What is the output of this program?

int main() {
    int sum = 0;
    int nums[] = { 1, 2, 3 };
    for (int i = 0; i <= 3; i++) {
        sum += nums[i];
    }
    printf("%d\n", sum);
}

Q4:

int main() {
    char first[] = "Colgate";
    char second[10] = "Univ";
    printf("%lu\n", strlen(first));
    printf("%lu\n", strlen(second));
    first[strlen(first)] = '-';
    second[strlen(second)-1] = '.';
    printf("%s%s\n", first, second);
    first[3] = '.';
    first[4] = '\0';
    printf("%s %s\n", first, second);
}

Q5:

int main() {
    char first[] = "Systems is fun!";
    char second[] = "Systems is fun!";
    if (first == second) {
        printf("1st == 2nd\n");
    }
    if (strcmp(first, second) == 0) {
        printf("1st cmp 2nd\n");
    }
    if (first == first) {
        printf("1st == 1st\n");
    }
    if (strcmp(first, first) == 0) {
        printf("1st cmp 1st\n");
    }
}

Q6:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
int main() {
    char str[100];
    printf("String? ");
    fgets(str, 100, stdin);
    for (int i = strlen(str); i >= 0; i--) {
        printf("%c", str[i]);
    }
    printf("\n");
}
